body:
I suppose whether 0.9/255 should be 0 or 1 depends on whether you want your int domain to consist of equal-sized buckets. The current behavior implements a floor. I believe this is the correct behavior, since it maps 0..1 into 256 equal-sized buckets. 

If you use round behavior as you suggest, [0..0.5) is mapped to 0, then you have 254 buckets of size 1, and finally another bucket of size 0.5. 

I believe floor is the better solution here. However, I recognize this could be considered  a matter of taste. We cannot change behavior though, so we should leave this alone.
